intro: Delphinium nevskii, commonly known as the Siberian larkspur, is a perennial herb native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the Ranunculaceae family and is characterized by its tall, sparsely branched stems that can reach up to 2 meters in height. The plant produces showy blue to purple flowers in raceme-like clusters, which bloom in late summer. Its leaves are alternate, pinnately divided, and covered with a fine layer of white hairs. Delphinium nevskii is adapted to cold, alpine environments and is often found in rocky soils at high elevations.
